question.text: Which of the following represents the correct combination without any exception?

options.text:
Characteristics Class
Mouth ventral; 5 -7 pairs of gills; skin with placoid scales; persistent notochord Chondrichthyes

Characteristics Class
Sucking and circular mouth; jaws present, integument without scales; paired appendages Cyclostomata

Characteristics Class
Body covered with feathers; skin moist and glandular; hindlimbs form wings; lungs with air sacs Aves

Characteristics Class
Mammary gland; hair on body; pinnae; two pairs of limbs Mammalia

solution.text: Class Pisces is divided into two groups: Chondrichthyes and Osteichthyes. Chondrichthyes are cartilaginous fishes. These have a ventral mouth, placoid scales while air bladder and operculum are absent. Thus they differ from Osteichthyes. These do not show 5-7 pairs of gill slits. Cyclostomatas are chordates with circular mouth but jaws are absent and hence are known as Agnathas. Class Aves belongs to tetrapods in which fore limbs are modified into wings. All mammals have mammary glands, hair on body and two pairs of limbs. All mammals have pinnae except aquatic mammals.
